name: Braised Short Ribs
description: Flanken-style short ribs braised in Zinfandel wine with tomatoes, vegetables, and porcini mushrooms.
instructions: Season ribs with salt and pepper. In a mixing bowl, whisk wine, sugar, tomatoes, broth, garlic, thyme, bay leaves, and a pinch of salt.
Pour canola oil into heavy pot. Brown the meat on all sides.
Remove beef after browning. Add onions, carrots and celery, allowing onion to cook until brown, about 10 minutes.

Return beef to pot with wine mixture; allow wine to boil before reducing heat, skimming fat from surface. After simmering several minutes, add mushrooms. Cover and simmer over very low heat until meat is tender, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Once ribs are cooked, remove from pot and keep warm; turn up heat and reduce liquids until thickened, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer ribs to shallow bowl; spoon liquid over top.
